Row.Text: Shimizu Mega City Pyramid
+200 [ICON_GOLD], +20 [ICON_FOOD], +20 [ICON_CULTURE], +20 [ICON_PRODUCTION], +10 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1], and 1 Free Great Artist in the city it was built in
[NEWLINE]"Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great."[NEWLINE] - Mark Twain [NEWLINE]

The Shimizu Mega-City Pyramid is a proposed project for construction of a massive pyramid over Tokyo Bay in Japan. The structure would be about 14 times higher than the Great Pyramid at Giza, and would house 1,000,000 people. The structure would be 2000 meters (6,561 feet) above mean sea level, including 5 stacked trusses, each with similar dimensions to that of the great pyramid of Giza. This pyramid would help answer Tokyo's increasing lack of space, although the project would only handle 1/47th of the Greater Tokyo Area's population. [NEWLINE] The proposed structure is so large that it cannot be built with currently available materials, due to their weight. The design relies on the future availability of super-strong lightweight materials based on carbon nanotubes.[NEWLINE]Requires a nearby Ocean[NEWLINE]
U.N. Headquarters
Grants 3 additional Delegates in the World Congress.

The headquarters of the United Nations is a complex in New York City. The complex has served as the official headquarters of the United Nations since its completion in 1952. It is located in the Turtle Bay neighborhood of the borough of Manhattan, on spacious grounds overlooking the East River. Its borders are First Avenue on the west, East 42nd Street to the south, East 48th Street on the north and the East River to the east. Turtle Bay is occasionally used as a metonym for the U.N. headquarters or for the U.N. as a whole.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Although it is situated in New York City, the land occupied by the United Nations Headquarters and the spaces of buildings that it rents are under the sole administration of the United Nations. They are technically extraterritorial through a treaty agreement with the U.S. government. However, in exchange for local police and fire protection and other services, the U.N. agrees to acknowledge most local, state, and federal laws.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The United Nations Headquarters complex was constructed in stages with the core complex completed between 1948-1952. The Headquarters occupies a site beside the East River, on 17 acres (69,000 m2) of land purchased from the foremost New York real estate developer of the time, William Zeckendorf, Sr. Nelson Rockefeller arranged this purchase, after an initial offer to locate it on the Rockefeller family estate of Kykuit was rejected as being too isolated from Manhattan. The US$8.5 million purchase was then funded by his father, John D. Rockefeller, Jr., who donated it to the city. Wallace Harrison, the personal architectural adviser for the Rockefeller family, and a prominent corporate architect, served as the Director of Planning for the United Nations Headquarters. His firm, Harrison and Abramovitz, oversaw the execution of the design.
London Array
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"When no wind blows, even the weathervane has character."[NEWLINE] - Stanislaw Lec[NEWLINE][TAB]
+2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Sea Tiles worked by this City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must be built on the coast.

The London Array is an offshore wind farm under construction in the outer Thames Estuary in the United Kingdom. With 1,000 megawatt (MW) nameplate capacity, it is expected to become the world's largest offshore wind farm. The site is 28.60 km off the North Foreland on the Kent coast in the area of Long Sand and Kentish Knock, and will cover 230 km2 between Margate in Kent and Clacton in Essex. The first foundation was installed in March 2011 and phase I is expected to be completed end 2012 at a cost of Â£1.8 billion and will deliver a capacity of 630 MW. As of December 13th, 2012 all 175 turbines have been installed, and the first 55 have been connected to the grid. An additional 10 are expected to be connected each week.
Rice

Rice is a cereal grain produced primarily from plants of the Oryza genus. It serves as the staple crop for millions of people worldwide, mainly in areas of Eastern and Southern Asia and the West Indies, each group having their own preferences as to the preparation of the crop. Different regions also have different ways to grow Rice - in flatter areas of Japan and China, Rice is grown in large fields known as Rice Paddies, whereas in areas with less flat ground such as the mountainous areas of China or the Philippines, terraces are cut into the mountainside for Rice to be grown in, to support the wet conditions needed for the rice to grow.
Banaue Rice Terraces
Provides +3 [ICON_RES_RICE] Rice.
[NEWLINE]"From wonder into wonder existence opens."[NEWLINE] - Lao Tzu[NEWLINE]

5000 feet above the sea, covering approximately 4000 square miles of Ifagao mountainside, sits the Banaue Rice Terraces. The terraces are about 2000 years old, built by the ancient indigenous Ifugao, and is still fed today by an ancient irrigation system using the rainforests above. It is common belief that the ancient terraces were built with minimal equipment and mostly by hand. It is said that putting the steps to travel the terraces end to end, they would encircle half the Equator of our Earth. The Ifugao culture is dominated by the use of rice, introducing the many rice culture feasts to the young and agricultural rites from the cultivation to consumption of rice.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Today the terraces are still in use, farming rice and vegetables to the Ifugao. However, more of the Ifugao find farming unappealing to other industries. This has resulted in a slow erosion of the site - the steps having been most affected - and the greater need for care of the site. In 2010 a greater problem emerged - drought - which caused the terraces to dry up entirely by March.
Council of the elder
upps
+1 Science.
Elders are known by their interest in mentoring, sharing their long life experiences.
Food Storage
The Food Storage is usually a cool cave or cavity, where food is kept fresh longer. Build it to increase the Growth and Wealth of your City.
Provides a little boost for Food and Gold.
Grants additional [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_GOLD] Gold for your community.[NEWLINE]Becomes obsolete with the discovery of Pottery.
Secret Agency
Secret Agency
Provides one extra spy and it grands a free unit the Spion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]NOTE: The buildings [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Military Academy[ENDCOLOR] is needed in the City.
Grands one free spy that can be uses as a spy or a embassador.

In espionage jargon, an agent refers to the person who does the spying; a citizen of one country who is recruited by a second country to spy on or work against his own country or a third country. In popular usage, this term is often erroneously applied to a member of an intelligence service who recruits and handles agents; in espionage such a person is referred to as an intelligence officer, intelligence operative or case officer. There are several types of agent in use today.
Plastic Factory
+10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in this City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requries one resource of [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Oil and Electricty[ENDCOLOR] to build.
Provides a boost for production.

Plastics engineering encompasses the processing, design, development, and manufacture of plastics products. A plastic is a polymeric material that is in a semi-liquid state, having the property of plasticity and exhibiting flow. Plastics engineering encompasses plastics material and plastic machinery. Plastic Machinery is the general term for all types of machinery and devices used in the plastics processing industry. The nature of plastic materials poses unique challenges to an engineer. Mechanical properties of plastics are often difficult to quantify, and the plastics engineer has to design a product that meets certain specifications while keeping costs to a minimum. Other properties that the plastics engineer has to address include; outdoor weatherability, thermal properties such as upper use temperature, electrical properties, barrier properties, and resistance to chemical attack.
upps
Bonfire
upps
The Bonfire increases your [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens' [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness. Build it when your city grows larger to avoid an unhappy nation.
+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food , [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.[NEWLINE]Becomes obsolete with the discovery of Calendar.
Synthetic Petrol Plant

Synthetic fuel is a liquid fuel obtained from coal, natural gas, oil shale, or biomass. It may also refer to fuels derived from other solids such as plastics or rubber waste. It may also (less often) refer to gaseous fuels produced in a similar way. Common use of the term "synthetic fuel" is to describe fuels manufactured via Fischer Tropsch conversion, methanol to gasoline conversion, or direct coal liquefaction. Direct conversion of coal to synthetic fuel was originally developed in Germany. Synthetic fuel grades included, "first quality aviation gasoline", "aviation base gasoline" and "gasoline - middle oil"; "producer gas" and diesel were synthesized for fuel as well (e.g., converted armored tanks used producer gas). By early 1944, German synthetic fuel production had reached more than 124,000 barrels per day. July 2009 worldwide commercial synthetic fuels production capacity is over 240,000 barrels per day, with numerous new projects in construction or development.

If you don't have enough crude Oil supply and don't wan't to start a war for it the Synthetic Petrol Plant is the solution![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It will convert your spared Coal into high grade aviation gasoline and Diesel.
This building requires 5 [ICON_RES_COAL] Coal and will provide 3 [ICON_RES_DIESEL] Diesel and 3 [ICON_RES_KEROSENE] Kerosene.
Steel Foundry
Requires 1 [ICON_RES_COAL] Coal and 2 [ICON_RES_IRON]. Output : 5 Steel.
A Steel Foundry provides provides you with the steel needed for advanced weapons.

A foundry is a factory that produces metal castings. Metals are cast into shapes by melting them into a liquid, pouring the metal in a mold, and removing the mold material or casting after the metal has solidified as it cools. The most common metals processed are aluminum and cast iron. However, other metals, such as steel, magnesium, copper, tin, and zinc, are also used to produce castings in foundries.

Set.Text: Constructs a Kasbah, grands one free resource Manpower,also increases the amount of [ICON_FOOD] Food, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and [ICON_GOLD] Gold provided by this tile. Also provides a defensive bonus.
Constructs a Chateau which increases the Culture and Gold yield of the tile. Also provides a defensive bonus and one resource Manpower.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Love is a fruit in season at all times and within the reach of every hand."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Mother Teresa

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Socrates

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"It may be true that the law cannot make a man love me, but it can keep him from lynching me, and I think that's pretty important."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Martin Luther King, Jr.
Aviation ([ICON_RESEARCH])
Allows the construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gateway Arch[ENDCOLOR] wonder.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"What kind of man would live where there is no daring? I don't believe in taking foolish chances but nothing can be accomplished without taking any chance at all."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Charles Lindbergh
Criminology ([ICON_RESEARCH])
Allows the construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Police Station[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Prison[ENDCOLOR] building.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Men stumble over the truth from time to time, but most pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing happened."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Sir Winston Churchill

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Nikola Tesla

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Man, of all the animals, is probably the only one to regard himself as a great delicacy."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Jacques Cousteau

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Know how sublime a thing is to suffer and be strong. "[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Henry Wadsworth Longfellow ( 1807 ~ 1882 )

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Woody Allen

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"No company is preferable to bad. We are more apt to catch the vices of others than virtues, as disease is far more contagious than health."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Charles Caleb Colton

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"We don't know a millionth of one percent about anything."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Thomas Edison
Touristics ([ICON_PRODUCTION])

Steel
To get Steel you a supply of Iron and Coal and a Steel Foundry.
Steel

Steel is an alloy that consists mostly of iron and has a carbon content between 0.2% and 2.1% by weight, depending on the grade.[NEWLINE] Though steel had been produced by various inefficient methods long before the Renaissance, its use became more common after more-efficient production methods were devised in the 17th century. With the invention of the Bessemer process in the mid-19th century, steel became an inexpensive mass-produced material. (Source : Wikipedia)
Spion
Spion.
Spion.
Savage

The Savage is particularly useful when attacking enemy settlements. Armed with half a tree as weapon, he can easily bring down enemy fortifications.[NEWLINE]Protect it from attacks, as it is weak when defending.
An exceptionally big and strong human specimen with a bad temper.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receives a bonus when attacking Cities, but also a penalty when defending.

In times when weapons were dull and military strategy was virtually non-existent, muscle power was the main tool of winning a fight. Especially strong and big men made good front-line warriors, who often fought in reckless rage. Nearly unstoppable when attacking, the Berserk fighters often did not watch their backs and were susceptible to strategic attacks.
Fire Eater
A useful unit for all purposes, the Fire Eater is the first ranged unit in the Prehistoric Era. Use it to burn down cities or attack enemies, but protect it from melee attacks.
Prehistoric ranged unit, throws burning torches at the enemy.[NEWLINE]Has a short range, but may move after attacking.

After the discovery of Fire as a beneficial tool for cooking and surviving harsh winters, Man also found out about its destructive power. Fire was - and still is - a powerful element that can burn skin and turn buildings to cinders. For millennia, armies have made use of torches and burning projectiles of all sizes against their enemies.
Caveman
Take club, use club on enemy's head. All a Caveman needs to know.
The earliest and weakest military unit in the game.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Not very smart, but determined.

In the earliest times of humanity, the Homo Sapiens Sapiens often used to live in caves, which provided shelter and protection before the invention of hut and house building. Armed with rudimentary weapons, like clubs or stones, they fought small battles between communities, or amongst themselves.
Growth
Provides a Food boost.
Allows to transform 25% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production output of the city into [ICON_FOOD] Food
